info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 2:22AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL HUNTINGDON AND SOUTHEASTERN BLAIR COUNTIES THROUGH 245 AM EDT... At 222 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southwest of Huntingdon, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Huntingdon, Mount Union, Rockhill Furnace, Dudley, Raystown Dam, Trough Creek State Park, Entriken, Shy Beaver, McConnellstown, Broad Top City, Mapleton, Orbisonia, Saltillo, Mill Creek, Kistler, Marklesburg, Shirleysburg, Cassville, Coalmont and Juniata College. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
